title: Control Structures
description: This chapter gives an overview of JavaScript statements and describes the process of automatic semicolon insertion. You will learn about comparisons, branches, and loops. I assume that you know how to code branches and loops in a language such as Java, C++, or Python, and focus on what is different in JavaScript.

courses.title: Expressions, Statements, Semicolons
courses.description: In this scenario, you will study the difference between expressions and statements, as well as the rules for semicolon insertion.

courses.title: Comparisons, Boolean Operators, Boolishness
courses.description: In this scenario, you will learn how to work effectively with Boolean values (true/false) in JavaScript, and how to avoid the foolishness of unrestrained Boolean conversions.

courses.title: For Loops
courses.description: This scenario shows the two forms of the "for" loop that are different from the standard "for" loop in Java or C++.
